website_summaries.verdict: For a gluten-free flour that also packs an extra punch of vitamins, we like the King Arthur.
pros: Use the same amount of this product as you would regular flour for recipes
Doesn't have the grit problems of some other gluten-free flour mixes
cons: The measure-for-measure flour is convenient, but has added sorghum and xanthan gum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Substitute for AP Flour
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect substitute for regular flour for anyone that either wants or needs to remove Gluten from their diet. I have tried a number of other GF AP Flour substitutes and this one acts as close to regular flour as I have found. For those that would rather not mix their own GF Flour, this is the product for you. As a long time chef, who had to relearn how to cook, due to my wife being diagnosed with Celiac Disease, this has been my go to for well over a year
customer_reviews.author: Tommy PI

customer_reviews.title: Nice but use less that cup for cup.
customer_reviews.text: I normally make my own blend of gluten free flour but decided to give this a try as King Arthur has a great reputation with other products. It says that it is cup for cup but I found my products a little stiff. I made a batch of Sandies cookies, bread dough for cinnamon rolls and dough for dumplings. There wasn't enough flour left for rolling things out so had to use other that I already had. Other than maybe needing to use a little less than called for, I believe this worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: psyco24

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make Irish soda bread. Came out perfect. We noticed a slightly different texture to the bread. Almost, for lack of a better word, creamier. I do not mean it negatively. It was delicious. The flour seems finer than regular flour. It's unfortunate that gluten free is so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bors

customer_reviews.title: Best GF ever
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many gluten free flours and they have a terrible after taste. This has been the best! Everything tastes normal!!! My daughter made brownies using this flour and I had to double check that she made them gluten free. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose flour.
customer_reviews.text: Use this flour for all of my all purpose flour recipes and baking. Works well when recipe calls for coating food with flour (chicken, beef stew, and more) and for keeping flour from sticking for rolling cookies and pie crusts. Even used it to make a coffee cake and substituted one-for-one measure. I have all kinds of non-gluten flours (my husband is a celiac patient), and I reach for this flour 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Chalky and Grainy
customer_reviews.text: I'm very confused by all the high ratings. I used this flour on numerous recipes and each time there's always a grainy/gritty after taste as well as the texture. I will not be repurchasing or finishing up this product. This makes me hesitant to try any else from King Arthur.
customer_reviews.author: LilH

customer_reviews.title: Has a horrible bitter after taste - skip this product
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this flour was not a solution for Christmas baking. The cookies turned out with a horrible bitter aftertaste. Haven’t tried it with anything else because we had to throw out a couple of dozen cookies that my daughter made for our GF family members. Super disappointed. I expected better from King Arthur. Worst of all I have 3 bags of this flour. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning

customer_reviews.title: Mold on inside and outside of bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this flour regularly but this last time there was mold on both the inside and outside of the bag. 😞 I had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Maryam A

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE WASTE
customer_reviews.text: #1 I now live in the backwoods of Missouri, and always bake my own bread #2 Came from Newport Beach, beach girl, know about Everything When I attempted first loaf, it didn't raise. Figured my yeast had gone bad. Tried another, still didn't raise. Screw me once, make a fool of me. Screw me twice, make a fool outta you!
customer_reviews.author: natasha

customer_reviews.title: Made the best gluten-free sandwich bread
customer_reviews.text: While King Arthur says this bread is not ideal for yeast-products, I found it still works. In the pictures, I made a 2LB gluten-free sandwich bread using a Pullman loaf pan with a lid. It came out so great, and the bread was a hit in the house. One pound was downed within the first hour. Easily the best bread I've had. I highly recommend this flour!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The alternative I've been waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: I've been gluten free for close to a decade. I've tried every GF flour you can imagine. I've never been happier than with this one.PRICE - drastically lower than my grocery store TASTE - mild - no particular flavor stands out like some other brands SNEAKABILITY - yes that's a real word - your family will never know it's GF CONVENIENCE - everything you need is in there - even the xanthan gum RECIPES - there are plenty on the King Arthur Website, but the beauty of this is the ability to use it in any recipe calling for all-purpose flour. So make your favorites for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: 1PickyWoman😋

customer_reviews.title: Too hard, not taste and dry.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flour because of the good reviews. However, I had a disappointment. My cakes and bread were very hard and dry and with a strong taste of rice which normally doesn't happen with regular flour. I thought very differently compared to regular flour.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Broke out Bad
customer_reviews.text: My daughters allergic to wheat and when we made cookies with this flour, she broke out is the largest hives I’ve ever seen all over her body for 3 days. Had to get prescribed steroids to get rid of them. I do t know why but I’m guessing cross contamination in the manufacturing process. Please study the products. I haven’t heard of any recalls.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option for GF all purpose flour
customer_reviews.text: King Arthur has excellent quality all purpose flour but unfortunately the Gluten Free (GF) flour does not bake well. I tried this flour for bread, rolls, pancakes, and cookies & the flour did not perform. The bread loaf/rolls did not rise and all dishes had a chalky consistency. Since I have two large bags of this flour I will continue to experience & update my review as appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: marley

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is THE best!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down, THE best GF measure for measure flour! I have tried making my own with a variety of GF flours and tried other cup for cup mixes and none compare (Bob's Red Mill 1:1 comes in second of the ones I have tried, IMO). It is the closest thing to regular AP flour. Recipes turn out great and it does not taste like (tylical) GF... can even fool my husband. :) It is wonderful to be able to use my old recipes again! This is all I buy now. All King Arthur brand GF products are excellent. Try it, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2One

customer_reviews.title: Its Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have been working with gluten free substitutes for eight years; this it the greatest gluten free flour ive come across. You can use it for ANYTHING. I have made cake and cookies, thickened soups and sauce/gravy, used for dusting fish for pan frying... Works the same as all purpose flour, no additional efforts; no extra eggs, no adding xantham gum or extra fats... so simple easy and delicious, i highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Moritz

customer_reviews.title: The best GF flour blend for baking!
customer_reviews.text: I've lived gluten free for a few years now due to problems with stomach issues and headaches when eating gluten. This flour blend is such a wonderful option for baking muffins, cupcakes, cookies, etc. Makes the baked goods light and fluffier than some others I've tried. Even my non-gluten-free coworkers and friends ask me to bring my baked goods because they are so good (and they are aware that I bake with GF flour)!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love this flour!
customer_reviews.text: This gluten free flour is perfect! I use it in everything that I plan to eat and don't have to adjust my recipes at all. My husband has not noticed any difference in anything I bake. Leave it to King Arthur to figure out how to make FG flour that doesn't require adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: The BEST GF flour but the bag had a hole in it - had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box it had about 1/4 pound of flour that had spilled out of a hole that was in the bag. As it arrived open, I was unable to use the flour. A terrible waste! This took the rating of this wonderful product from a 5 star to a 1 star - unfortunately 0 was not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Susan

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for gluten sensitive peopl
customer_reviews.text: This is a very convenient and very satisfactory product to give gf sensitive people the ability to enjoy nice treats. I have made pumpkin bread, chocolate bread, and Hawaiian bread (loaded with fruit additions) and been very pleased. My only failure has been peanut butter bread. The lack of gluten made a structure unable to support a heavy batter. The bread fell as it cooled. Otherwise, I’ve used my regular recipes with this flour with very good results. My only complaint is its rather high price which led to 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Pat J

customer_reviews.title: Thought I may have scored with a GF and allergy ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I may have scored with a GF and allergy free brand but before I used saw a ton of reviews of cross contamination with corn which is something I avoid. Tried to get reassurance from the conpany before use but they didn't really make me feel confident so just didn't try it. Just be weary if there's other things you have to avoid other than gluten.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Best gluten free flour blend on the market! You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I can not RAVE about this flour enough! Having been gluten free for 9 years, I feel like I’ve tried every flour blend on the market. All have been disappointing, until this one. It legitimately subs 1:1 in almost all recipes and yields excellent (like most people can’t even tell it’s gluten free excellent) results consistently. I always recommend this to our friends who want to bake for us, and I haven’t had anyone not like it. Plus, with subscribe and save it’s less than 1/2 the price of my local grocery store. Just get it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great GF flour!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flour! I've been gluten free for almost 8 years and found this flour about a year ago. I'm usually hesitant to try new mixes since I've been through a lot of them and hadn't found any I really loved. At first things just turned out ok with this flour but then I started using my scale and weighing out the flour. 1 cup=120 grams of this mix. It made a big difference to my recipes and now I use it exclusively when converting most recipes (with the exception of yeast bread recipes.) I've had excellent results with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rusch

customer_reviews.title: Great GF flour!
customer_reviews.text: I bake - a lot and with that said I would recommend this flour. I bake for someone who is celiac and it bakes as great as non gluten flour without any substitutions or additions of ingredients lacking. It is truly one cup gf flour to one cup regular flour perfect! It tastes just like the real recipe of cookie or cake or pancake I'm making. I can turn my non gluten recipe into a gluten free one so simply now! Love ti!
customer_reviews.author: Superbean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t measure up to the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: NOT equal to regular King Arthur all purpose flour. Disappointed with the baked pumpkin bread. It was for want of a better word “chalky.”
customer_reviews.author: W G

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this but.... too grainy
customer_reviews.text: I've been GF for a little bit. I've had to look high and low for great tasting things that are good for our family... When making pancakes... they came out super grainy... and only the kids ate it (because we lathered them with syrup... Unfortunately, I wanted to love this... I really did. I will have to keep paying the extra money for the Cup4Cup flour..... until I can find something a bit more affordable. If you need something with a super smooth texture... then try Cup4Cup.
customer_reviews.author: I. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: New to gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: I've been baking a lot of breads and such and only have bread flour in the house. I couldn't find any AP flour so I decided to try this 1:1 gluten free flour. And I have to say I really like it. Gluten free flours tend to be a little gritty but my kids and husband didn't even notice when I used this to make cookies. I quickly moved through this bag of flour and it was unavailable when I needed to re-order so I picked up some Bobs Red Mill, and I have to say that while I LOVE Bobs Red Mill, this flour is MUCh better.
customer_reviews.author: jennys

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: If you must go Gluten Free or want to go Gluten Free then you need to purchase King Arthur Gluten Free flour. Do look at the front as there are different kinds of King Arthur Gluten Free Flour. They have multi purpose and all purpose and that is not the same thing. Their flour makes some of the best muffins (banana and pumpkin). Of course you can do other baking as well. I am still trying to master the bread, but I will get it right one of these days. Starting out try King Arthur Flour Gluten Free !
customer_reviews.author: DS in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative flour!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this and have only used in one recipe but was so impressed I had to write a review. I made crepes and was hesitant to use cup for cup as all purpose flour. For anyone who’s ever experimented with alternative flours, you know just because it says 1:1 does not mean it really is. Crepes turned out light as air! Can’t wait to use this in cookies and breads! Note: kudos to Amazon too as my first bag arrived with a huge rip in it. They sent a replacement bag that was delivered the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Breezers

customer_reviews.title: Just substitute for the flour in your recipe-works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: My dad has a gluten allergy, but loves to eat the cakes I make. I bought this to test out some gluten free recipes, but I did not have to do any substitutions, and the cakes came out great and my dad got to enjoy some dessert! I had read about some of the things you have to do when baking with gluten free flours, but with this product, you simply substitute this flour part for part in your cake recipe and it works wonderfully! I used my grandma’s cake recipe, and she had no idea I used gluten free flour. :)
customer_reviews.author: LR14

customer_reviews.title: Best GF I've found for general baking
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many pre-made gluten free flour blends, and to make pancakes, waffles, and chocolate chip cookies, I've had the best luck with this product. Another product sucks up so much moisture, pancakes and waffles are nearly impossible to make. And cookies spread out too far (strange when it sucks up all the moisture). But King Arthur works almost as well as regular flour. There is very little grittiness, my chocolate chip cookies don't taste gluten free (as 3 people told me today at a party), and it's easy to work with. It's also a bit cheaper than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Azzacca

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I have found this flour - new freedom
customer_reviews.text: Very glad I have found this flour - worked very well so far in a Victoria sponge, pancakes, crepes as well as choux pastry, gnocchi and dumplings. Also a great service - I was not sure if it will do the job for choux pastry, posted a question and got a response from the manufacturer within 30 min - it was great to be able to enjoy a gf croquembouche with everyone. The only difference from non a gf output was that the buns were much lighter in texture. Can’t complain - reordered.
customer_reviews.author: Alka

customer_reviews.title: Really can use it cup for cup in a recipe
customer_reviews.text: Love this flour! I have been baking GF for years for my son, and this mix has eliminated all the other flours I would have to buy to bake with. One bag, cup for cup on any recipe. Most people can not even tell it is a gf baked item. I have used it for cakes, cookies, banana bread, pancakes, pie crusts, and anything else that needs flour in it. It has been a life saver and made gf baking so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: cemnei

customer_reviews.title: A little chalky but delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I used this flour for the first time to make homemade cookies. I was a little worried it would make them gritty so I let the dough sit for 30 minutes before I scooped it onto the cookie sheet to give time for the flour to soak in the liquids. Flavor was great! Texture was pretty good (definitely not gritty) but it left a little bit of a chalky coating in the mouth after. They were definitely best right out of the oven. They were really crumbly by day 2.
customer_reviews.author: Brin

customer_reviews.title: Look for other allergens in ingredient list.
customer_reviews.text: Be wary if you multiple food allergies. I didn't read the ingredient list as I had searched for this as sorghum flour. Unfortunately won't be able to use this as it contains potato starch/ flour. I have a potatoes allergy along with gluten sensitivity...unfortunately to many gluten free flours rely on potato flour.
customer_reviews.author: Black Knight

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GLUTEN FREE OPTION
customer_reviews.text: I am sure that I am not the only one doing extra baking recently. With our daughter home from college, and recently giving up gluten. I did a search for gluten free flour at our local markets. The shelves were bare and she was missing out on our baked treats, I was excited when an Amazon search revealed King Arthur Flour, Measure for Measure Flour, Gluten Free, 3 Pound (Pack of 1). Everyone agrees that my baking tastes just as good using this. I have purchase it more than once.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Good for your health (apparently), no gluten, no inflammation and all, but truth be told, it isn't quite the same as traditional flour in terms of texture and taste. Your pancakes won't ever taste the same:) and this flour seems to have some difficulties in biding, making crepes is challenging because they are not as solid and break easily...but what woudln't we do to eliminate gluten right?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a little pricey but when a great friend has Celiac Disease I want to be able to cook for her and feel safe. Made lots of cookies and pies that she loved and thanks to having this flour it works great. I had never used this flour but did great as I left the dough to rest and absorb the liquid and the cookies turned out great. The pie I made was great too. I use Vodka (Tito's) for the GF. and a little water. I use any other Vodka when I make my crusts and they turn out flaky and everyone loves the crust.
customer_reviews.author: KLJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my daughter in law who has changed to a gluten free diet. I'd never made gluten free food before but used this to make rolls and crepes and it worked really well. I couldn't even tell the difference in the crepes. It is expensive compared to normal flour but it worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah! My search is over!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only gluten free flour I will use anymore! I have tried more than I can count. I have also researched the price many times over the last couple years and each and every time Amazon cannot be beat. What I like most about King Arthur’s gluten-free flour is that it comes with xanthan gum already in there. So many gluten-free flours land you with bland food that crumbles because it lacks the elasticity that gluten provides. The baked goods coming out of this household are officially fooling everybody!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Karsten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect flour for GF baking
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try GF for a possible connection with my thyroid issues after hearing a doctor speak on the topic. Unfortunately I didn’t last but I can tell you I used all of this flour in cooking and baking and literally could not tell the difference. I know that it was a legit product though, because the stomach aches I wake up with every single morning we’re not present when I was gluten free. I really should try again...
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow! I am a long time baking enthusiast. I recently wanted to try to go gluten free in order to narrow down my allergy triggers. So, since I totally love King Arthur Organic All Purpose Wheat flour, I looked first with them for Gluten Free flour. This was amazing. I didn't change a thing about my tried and true chocolate chip recipe and they came out so GOOD!!! Give it a try for yourself. All I've done so far was my CCC recipe but I will try something else soon. The holiday season is upon us!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Shick

customer_reviews.title: Near Expiration Date
customer_reviews.text: I've used this flour before ordering it from Amazon and have always been pleased with the results I've had. It's easy to substitute in recipes calling for plain flour. I've used it in baking my mother's 50-year-old recipe for carrot cake and it yields a moist and delicious cake. Not pleased that this particular order of flour arrived with an expiration date of less than two months.
customer_reviews.author: PeaRose

customer_reviews.title: It really is measure for measure flour.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to gf baking. I heard from a friend that Anthony's products were trustworthy, so I bought this flour. I baked corn bread, pancakes and a pie crust. The cornbread was perfect. The pancakes were good, though not quite the same as wheat pancakes, said one of my family members. The pie crust was not easy to roll out, but once we got it in the pan and added the filling it stayed put. We made a nice berry pie with a cross-cross crust and no one noticed that the gluten was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Shazam

customer_reviews.title: Just like flour
customer_reviews.text: My mom has Celiac disease, diagnosed for a little over 10 years now. It’s amazing how far gluten free products have come over the years. I bought this due to the high ratings, and my mom constantly tells me how great it is. She made her southern fried cornbread with it and it was absolutely delicious. Thank you for a great, quality flour!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive based on reviews - I normally use the All Purpose Gluten Free by King Arthur Flour. I tried this one because it is a better deal and its amazing - even better quality!!! I'm not gluten free but I bake for people that are and I also eat this way at times and it tastes the same with this - if anything it tastes better. I buy this at the store but will start buying on amazon because its a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: NOT a measure-for-measure substitute
customer_reviews.text: Not a measure to measure “flour”. Used this to make biscuits as a friend of mine is gluten free. Followed my usual recipe and substituted the real flour of this “flour”. Biscuits came out pasty, pale and flavorless. Gluten free baking is a science that’s not just replace this real flour with this stuff. I’m sure this stuff can be useful in gluten free recipes. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Miarecki

customer_reviews.title: Was t
customer_reviews.text: Sorry...but don’t purchase unless you know what your buying! Went by reviews and really disappointed...biscuits were a big flop!
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect flour replacement
customer_reviews.text: My absolute favorite GF flour. I use it as an exact measurement replacement on any recipe. I’ve had celiac for 16 years and this is a solid pantry staple. Baked goods, stews, rouxes, all of it. Take any recipe that calls for flour and use this as an easy replacement. The best.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Must have, great for baking with better than expected results!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this flower to make some cookies for a friend who is gluten intolerant. She absolutely loved the cookies and said the flavor was incredible. After tasting the cookies myself (and looking for the “not bad” I guess moment) I cannot express in words just how wonderful this product is. No fiddling around with my recipe, used it exactly as I would regular AP flour and had better than expected results. This will be a staple in my cabinet now.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Campers

customer_reviews.title: Confused about the good reviews.  Gritty
customer_reviews.text: Gritty. I was excited because of all the great reviews. Clearly no one has tried the Gluten free mama flour. Now THATS great flour with no gritty consistency. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Planks

customer_reviews.title: Gluten-free flour at its finest
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been gluten-free since Feb 2013. During that time I’ve tried many gluten-free flours and this one is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen L. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: First time I've used this product for my gluten free baking. Sadly, I wasn't impressed. The taste of everything we made was off...cookies, waffles, etc. For our tastes, we've found that when using a GF baking mix that we need to add extra salt and sugar. Even the extra salt and sugar didn't improve the flavor of our goodies. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay gluten free flour, but not the greatest. I couldn't find my favorite gf flour anywhere and I cook a lot from scratch, so I really needed gf flour. I like the King Arthur gluten free pancake mix, so I thought I'd give the gf flour a try. I was underwhelmed. It's gritty, and the flavor, to me, is off. It's not the worst I've tried, but it's not the best, either.
customer_reviews.author: EmBee

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product- No returns
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what this tastes like or how it bakes because I'm allergic to xanthan gum and cannot use it. I thought I was purchasing the xanthan-free blend. Now I'm being told that this product is not eligible for returns. Most prime purchases ARE eligible, so if your product is not, you should really make that clear. Also make it more clear that this product contains xanthan, since it looks almost identical to the xanthan-free all purpose flour.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: No gritty texture
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good gluten free flour. So many GF flours have this gritty ground rice texture, but this does not. It is light and fluffy and cooks up just like typical flour. While it's true if you have celiac, you have to pay extra for everything (so unfair) this is at least more reasonably priced than many items. I would recommend it, it has good flavor unlike some that taste of garbanzo beans...
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Good tasting GF flour
customer_reviews.text: I have used another brand of gluten free flour that bakes up well, but seems to have a texture or flavor that doesn't quite make me happy. I decided to try the King Arthur brand and so far I like it better. The gluten free pumpkin bars I made were happily eaten by guests and pickier grandchildren alike. The price is more reasonable than some flours and the shipping was fast and easy... still, I would love to see the price come down more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Paul

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: So before I discovered I had a Gluten allergy I always used King Arthur Floor for my breads and pastries. It is an employee owned company that really takes pride in their products. The new Gluten-Free flour lives up to the King Author name, and best of all, it measures exactly the same as regular flour. So far I've used it for muffins, pancakes as well as a Banana-Walnut Bread that I haven't been able to enjoy for many years - so good in the morning with a cup of coffee. Best of all my family can't tell the difference from regular flour.
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixMDZ

customer_reviews.title: This is the best GF flour we've found
customer_reviews.text: If Amazon stops selling it, we might have to cancel Prime. Amazon consistently has it in stock. It's the best 1:1 analog for real flour we've found. It works in everything. Cookies, muffins, banana bread...
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not horrible but there are better brands
customer_reviews.text: For us, it seems to work ok in some recipes but not all. It’s very grainy. Did not do great with sandwich breads or pie crust or pizza dough. Does ok mixed in to recipes that call for a small amount of flour and was good for gravy, cookies, and banana bread. We have had better luck with Pamelas GF flour but wanted to try this for the price. Switching back to something that works for all that we cook.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, love it.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this flour, I make waffles with it, this morning I added a mashed banana to the flour and had tasty banana pancakes. I also find I do not gain weight from the waffles and pancakes... but that's just me! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Elisheva Basha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am a newly converted gluten free diner. This flour made it possible for me to enjoy my holiday goodies without the bloat and discomfort. And - major bonus - my niece, who has been gf for a few years, gave me 10 stars out of five! She said she couldn’t tell the difference. In fact the whole family was stunned when I revealed the truth. I used my normal recipes but subbed this flour and had zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: C. Z. Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Curve your Crankiness with King Arthur
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about King Arthur. Sometimes having a food allergy can make you feel a little cranky but this blend does help curve that feeling. Best value I’ve found for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Clore III

customer_reviews.title: Love this flour
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try making my own gluten free baked goods since I find those sold in stores to be too sweet, or if a bread, with a strange consistency. So far, I used it to make a classic yellow butter cake, and it turned out pretty good. I really like the idea that I can continue to use my regular recipes to bake with this flour. By the way, the King Arthur website has really good gluten free recipes...
customer_reviews.author: Elizbeth James

customer_reviews.title: love KA!
customer_reviews.text: we don't bake with anything but King Arthur flour, however, we didn't see a need to stock up on flour during the health crisis...who knew?!...anyway, we found this & since we trust KA's reputation & are familiar with their products, we went ahead & ordered it...haven't baked with it yet but plan to bake scones tomorrow...can't go wrong with KA!
customer_reviews.author: clapton

customer_reviews.title: It’s not natural!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware. This has a thicker chemical (ax than gum) that is not good for your health. They don’t say anything about it
customer_reviews.author: Petronela gianina

customer_reviews.title: I've had Celiac disease for 12 years and this is by far the best American-made flour blend!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had Celiac disease for 12 years and this is by far the best American-made flour blend I have used. It truly works measure-for-measure in every dish you could imagine. My husband makes the fluffiest waffles and you would never know they are gluten free. It's a much better price on Amazon than grocery stores, as the bag is twice the size of the ones you buy in stores for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: jamadoria

customer_reviews.title: 1-1 flour
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this was my first time using this flour. I really liked using it in baked goods such as, pancakes, corn patties, and items like cookies, muffins it works great. But not in bread. So I would buy this flour again however, I would also continue to buy regular flour as well. And this item is expensive way more expensive than basic flour.
customer_reviews.author: Ivona Williams

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE EVST GLUTEN FREE FLOUR ON THE MARKET!!! After years of tasting the GF aftertaste with other flours, it's so nice to have found this one that people can't tell the difference with. Actually, in taste tests with kids, they preferred this flour to regular, all purpose flour in cookies and cakes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this gluten free flour. A good gluten free flour is so hard to find, in my opinion. This works well for baking. I will be re-ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: The best Gluten Free Flour on the Market!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many Gluten free flours and will now ONLY use King Arthur Flour brand. It tastes just like regular flour and it bakes very well! I love that this bag has a ziplock top too so that it keeps it fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Huntyson

customer_reviews.title: So easy just to replace regular flour with
customer_reviews.text: Christmas cookies can be for the gluten free folks too I made 4 varieties and they all tasted just as good as the regular flour to the point the coworkers couldn’t tell the difference
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: The only gluten free brand we use!
customer_reviews.text: So very pleased with this and other gluten free flours from King Arthur! Their website has many great recipes and explains how this flou, and their other baking flours should be used.
customer_reviews.author: GloriaJoy

customer_reviews.title: Great flour for a non-gluten-free family
customer_reviews.text: I love this flour. A true staple in my pantry. I am gluten-free and always bake for my non-GF family; they can never tell this flour isn't the real thing. The texture isn't gritty like some GF alternatives are. It works so well in any baked good--cakes, cookies, brownies, etc. Wouldn't recommend for yeasted foods, though. My cinnamon rolls were kind of a flop.
customer_reviews.author: csd

customer_reviews.title: This is my go-to flour now - love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gluten-free flour, hands down. I use it in place of regular flour in almost all recipes with great success. My husband (who is not gluten sensitive) actually likes my scratch cake better with measure for measure than wheat flour. I’ve used it in cream sauces with great success, cornbread, muffins, brownies (try the recipe on the package). I find things don’t rise quite as high, but are tasty and din’t have the grit of some g-f flours.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Gritty
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out with my traditional chocolate chip cookie recipe and it tastes very gritty. Was hoping I would not be able to tell a difference, but you can definitely tell it's gluten free from the texture. Will need to adjust my recipes to compensate for the grittiness/chalkiness. The grittiness would be less noticeable in something like bisccuit or shortbread
customer_reviews.author: Ng Meowster

customer_reviews.title: New to GF
customer_reviews.text: Wheat and corn bothers my daughter's eczema so I'm learning to bake differently. So far I've tried several different brands and this is the best all purpose flour I've tried. Corn free and less starches and white rice then other brands. Everything I make with this comes out great. High quality and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - used for pizza and cake
customer_reviews.text: If you need a go to decent gluten free all purpose flour this is for you. We used it to make pizza and cake despite the recommendation and both came out wonderful. We made my dad a gluten free sugar free carrot cake and he had no idea the difference. It’s the cheapest per oz around.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this GF flour
customer_reviews.text: I only purchase this after using Bob's Red Mill GF flour for years. King Arthurs is never gritty and my adult children are always surprised that my cookies are GF.
customer_reviews.author: Brownieyumyum

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best yet. My gluten free cookies come out exactly like my non-GF cookies, with no further adjustments. The taste and texture are great. Cookie dough is firm, not pasty or sticky. Cookies crack and brown perfectly in the oven. I kept worrying I had accidentally used regular flour. This is the gluten free flour you’re looking for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burwell

customer_reviews.title: Taste like the real thing
customer_reviews.text: Since being diagnosed with food allergies I've tried so many brands of flour and this one actually taste and has the texture of the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jagstyle

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for wheat flour
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy be eating a luscious fluffy slice of gingerbread I just made with King Arthur Flour. Since it lacks guar gum (which isn't good for me anyway) I substituted chia seeds in my recipe. Very good. After opening I keep the bag of flour in the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: nc dog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality with an insane value!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this GF flour for a long time. Of all the GF flour’s we’ve tried it is the closest to a traditional flour in terms of baking. I love to bake and have baked since before my husband realized he has a gluten sensitivity. The recipes come out so perfect and people cannot tell it is GF flour which I love!!! This value you get is amazing- it’s like $3-$4 cheaper than trying to buy this flour in stores!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This is a good deal for people who must have gluten free products.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used King Arthur gluten free flour enough to rate it for taste , versatility, etc. but I've read good things. For example, America's Test Kitchen recommends it as an alternative to their own mix. I've found that gluten-free cooks are partial to their own mixes though sometimes cookbooks will begrudge a nod at another mix. To tell you the truth, they're all pretty similar in my opinion. Anyway, this is a qualified recommendation based on value for money. The price for the quantity is great.
customer_reviews.author: mawgrit

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free fortified flower, infinite culinary options!  Get it, be healthier.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy the world of recipes at your fingertips with this awesome gluten free fortified flour. Check out this breaded scrumptiousness I had the pleasure of creating and eating. You can do tons with this in a short time, make your own food, be healthier. It’s fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kendallyn

customer_reviews.title: I finally found great gluten free flour!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flour! I have used multiple brands of gluten free flour and this is my favorite. It has the best flavor and produces a great result. I have baked two kinds of bread and it’s the first bread I have been able to use for sandwiches. I got such a great rise!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GF flour!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite GF flour so far. It tastes as good as the non-GF. Other flours I have tried have either been too gritty or different in taste. As for recipes, it has been great! It acts just like regular flour. I use for breading my chicken, thickening my gravy, making my biscuits, etc! King Arthur has been my favorite brand so far. The baking mix is amazing also!
customer_reviews.author: fhlgurl13

customer_reviews.title: Best gluten free flour I have tried!
customer_reviews.text: This gluten free flour is the best I've used so far. I baked cookies this past weekend and they turned out perfect. I also baked a cake and it was good, but a little heavy. I will have to tweak it a bit for cakes but overall it is excellent. Plan on trying it in many more recipes and will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda S.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS FLOUR
customer_reviews.text: Great for GF baking, I make a sick banana bread that is moist and fluffy with this flour and some almond flour mixed in it. I learned some people who go GF may also have an allergy to potato starch. Fortunately I don't have a bad reaction to potato starch so this product is great for me and my family. This flour contains potato starch.
customer_reviews.author: Gisela

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gluten free flour I have tried. My oldest daughter was diagnosed with a wheat allergy 7 years ago and we’ve been experimenting with alternative wheat/gluten free foods for her ever since. This is the most versatile, affordable, and yummy wheat flour alternative we have found. I use it in biscuits, cakes, pretzels, and pie crust.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Flour!
customer_reviews.text: My first Christmas gluten free, I baked all my cookies with this flour for the first time. I did find I needed a tiny bit less flour because this absorbed more liquid, but overall excellent quality, no one could even tell they were gluten free! For measurement changes, depending on the wetness of the dough I reduced flour by 1/4-1/8th if a cup at most
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Bad texture
customer_reviews.text: The flour tastes wierd and is too grainy. It gives my food the texture of having sawdust or sand in them. Compared to cup4cup, it's not good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this is really easy to work with! I am new to the gluten free life and really like how this tastes! The only thing I can say is, this product is NOT for use with yeast (says on package although I didnt see it until I bought it). Makes great biscuits and cookies! love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different gluten free flours and, for me, this is the best by far. Easy to work with, especially when making pie crusts. This acts more like regular flour. I just wish it wasn't so hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Drapeau

customer_reviews.title: Ready to use like regular flour in your recipes
customer_reviews.text: We are not gluten free, but This flour seemed to work Just like regular flour. We had visited a family member and she made a gluten free cake that my husband loved. So I bought this flour to make the cake. I store it in the freezer since I don't use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Bam

customer_reviews.title: Love this Flour
customer_reviews.text: The best flour out there. High quality results when used in all recipes. I don’t use gluten free products for many items but this product is so good I buy it every time I get flour. The gluten free pancake mix is excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: J Graham

customer_reviews.title: Terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: I made Christmas cookies with this! What a disappointment! All those ingredients and they tasted terrible. I couldn’t get Cup4Cup brand, so I tried this instead. Never again. I’ll never buy King Arthur brand anything again!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Best flour alternative for GF People
customer_reviews.text: I am GF intolerant and was very skeptical about this flour. However, I now have it as part of my subscription. It really works and it just gives the slightest corn flavor. I am able to make and eat some "gluten" favorite foods without the harsh side effects of gluten by just substituting with this flour. Plus, it renders quite a bit. A win, win in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. E

customer_reviews.title: Closest thing to regular baking flour
customer_reviews.text: After baking biscuits using five different gluten-free flour brands, King Arthur turned out best. I have also used this flour to bake muffins and blueberry-oat bars and they always turn out great with King Arthur brand. I highly recommend this flour.
customer_reviews.author: Amalfi

customer_reviews.title: There is no competition to KA!
customer_reviews.text: There is NO better GF flour than KA! Loyal to the core. I’ve tried every available option that exists! KA - thank you! 💎💎💎PS, try their Espresso powder to create the depth in your chocolate recipes. Allows you to reduce the sugar used! 💎💎💎
customer_reviews.author: Inspirehealth4life

product_meta.title: King Arthur Flour, Measure for Measure Flour, Certified Gluten-Free, Non-GMO Project Verified, Certified Kosher, 3 Pounds (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Size:3 Pound (Pack of 1)Arthurs organic flour, and feel good about protecting the earth. A certified organic all purpose flour. Produced from hard red winter & spring wheats. Slightly lower protein level , perfect for all your baking. Makes great European style hearth breads. Store cool & dry one year.
feature_bullets: Arthurs organic flour, and feel good about protecting the earth! A certified organic all purpose flour

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
